p: Electrospinning, which is a versatile technique used for fabrication of nanostructures [ 74], tissue engineering [ 75], wound dressing [ 76], enzyme immobilization [ 77], electrode materials [ 78], and food packaging preparation [ 79], was recently reviewed as a method for EO encapsulation in membranes. The systems prepared by this procedure exhibited fibrous morphology with a large surface area to volume ratio, high porosity, and fiber diameters, in the range of nano to micron, and with favorable properties for the sustained release of active ingredients from the packaging membrane to various surfaces [ 80].
